-1.caption: 1967 Major League Baseball Hall of Fame Game

2.caption: 1967 Major League Baseball All-Star Game
2.description: The 1967 Major League Baseball All-Star Game was the 38th midseason exhibition between the all-stars of the American League (AL) and the National League (NL), the two leagues comprising Major League Baseball. The game was played on July 11, 1967, at Anaheim Stadium in Anaheim, California. The game resulted in a 2–1 15 inning victory for the NL. It set the record for the longest All-Star Game by innings, matched in 2008.
2.inspected:Radio announcers: Jim Simpson, Tony Kubek and Buddy Blattner
2.inspected:TV announcers: Curt Gowdy, Pee Wee Reese and Sandy Koufax
